perturbation.original_text: EIT is responsible for any damages caused to the Customer or to third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the contractual obligations.
perturbation.changed_text: EIT is accountable for any damages caused to the Client or to third parties, when these result from EIT not satisfying the contractual obligations.
perturbation.explanation: The terms “Customer” and “Client” are used interchangeably but are not explicitly defined as referring to the same entity. This could lead to disputes regarding liability if different departments or entities within Silicon Smelters are considered either 'Customer' or 'Client'.

perturbation.original_text: The Customer will benefit from the group contracts negotiated by EIT in name of Group Villar Mir for the purchase of licences.
perturbation.changed_text: The Beneficiary will benefit from the group contracts negotiated by EIT in name of Group Villar Mir for the purchase of licenses.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mentions 'Customer' will benefit from the group contracts, while the changed text uses the term 'Beneficiary', it is unclear whether 'Customer' and 'Beneficiary' are the same entity. This could cause disputes regarding who is entitled to the benefits of these contracts.

perturbation.original_text: The Customer and EIT will cooperate, in good faith, to make possible a transfer, in due form to the Customer or to a third party, chosen by the Customer, for the provision of the services defined in this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Recipient and EIT will cooperate, in good faith, to make possible a transfer, in due form to the Buyer or to a third party, chosen by the Customer, for the provision of the services defined in this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: Using 'Recipient' instead of 'Customer' at the start of the sentence, and then using 'Buyer' instead of 'Customer' in the first half of the sentence, and using the initial term again at the second half of the sentence creates confusion about who is receiving the data in the contract termination stage. The term 'Customer' is later used in the same sentence, compounding the issue.
